Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): Append missing AttrAst to AstPath
Issues.Body:
When a HTML Ast containing an Attribute node is converted to a Template Ast,
the attribute node might get dropped from the Template Ast path.
This is because the AttrNode is not even in the Template Ast to begin with.
In this case, we manually fix the path by converting the Attribute node
to a AttrAst node and appending it to the path.

This allows the `ExpressionVisitor` to properly visit the leaf node in the
TemplateAst path and remove optional `attr` parameter passed to `ExpressionVisitor`.

Issues.Title: Angular ng object is missing in production bundles in developer tools console
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8 ### Description In angular version 8 I had access to `window.ng` object in chrome developer tools console either in development build and in production build. Today I realized that with the 9.0.0-rc.x version (9.0.0-rc.5) I'm not able to access the `ng` object if the app is compiled for production. **PRODUCTION:** ![image](https://i.stack.imgur.com/li4Dk.gif) **DEVELOPMENT:** ![image](https://i.stack.imgur.com/pXJZZ.gif) ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Just use cli to generate a brand new project, upgrade it to the latest rc version and compile it to production. Issues.Title: RouterLink with queryParamsHandling preserve or merge does not work with OnPush change detection
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Not sure. ### Description Using the routerLink directive with queryParamsHandling preserve or merge in combination with OnPush change detection leads to incorrect links. I'm trying to use the routerLink directive with queryParamsHandling="preserve" in a component that uses OnPush change detection. However, if I set a query param, the param is not included in the link. The href of the link is not updated when the query param is set, so if I open the link in a new tab the query param is gone. A workaround for this is to call markForCheck whenever a NavigationEnd event occurs, but I think this use case should be handled by the routerLink directive itself. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/github/chrstnbrn/angular-routerlink-onpush-repro ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: ci(docs-infra): fix failure in `aio_monitoring_stable` due to yarn version mismatch
Issues.Body:
The `aio_monitoring_stable` CI job is triggered as a cronjob on the master branch and its purpose is to run some e2e tests against the deployed stable version of the docs web-app at https://angular.io/. In order for the tests to be compatible with the deployed version of the web-app (which gets deployed from the stable branch), the stable branch is checked out in git as part of the CI job.

Previously, we only checked out the `aio/` directory from the stable branch, leaving the rest of the code at master. This doesn't matter as long as the commands used to run the tests do not rely on code outside of `aio/`. However, it turns out that there _is_ code outside of `aio/` that affects the executed commands: It is our vendored version of yarn (in `third_party/github.com/yarnpkg/`), which overwrites the global yarn installed on the docker image on CI and must match the version range specified in `aio/package.json > engines`.

Using the yarn version checked out from the master branch with the `aio/` code checked out from the stable branch can lead to failures such as [this one][1].

This commit fixes the problem by checking out both the `aio/` and `third_party/github.com/yarnpkg/` directories from the stable branch and re-running the steps to overwrite the global yarn executable with our own version from `third_party/github.com/yarnpkg/`. This ensures that the version of yarn used will be compatible with the version range specified in `aio/package.json > engines`.

NOTE:
We cannot checkout everything from the stable branch, since the CI config (`.circleci/config.yml` from the master branch) may try to run certain scripts (such as `.circleci/get-vendored-yarn-path.js`) that are not available on the stable branch. Therefore, we should only check out the necessary bits from the stable branch.

[1]: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/567315
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci(docs-infra): fix failure in `aio_monitoring_stable` due to yarn version mismatch" (#34451)

# ğŸ bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
The issue is caused by package @angular/forms. maybe?


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
 Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was:  8.2.14


### Description

<!-- âœï¸--> A clear and concise description of the problem...

Our app is a dynamically generated form, with custom inputs using the `ControlValueAccessor` interface in order to bind those custom input changes to the main form.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3651787/71014994-d9e9a880-20c0-11ea-9803-33a4d4c76a0e.png)

After some testing I found something interesting, if I remove the following snippet `[required]="kapInput.required"` the error is gone. I also tried harcoding the required property to _true_ or _false_ but the error was still present. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3651787/71015147-21703480-20c1-11ea-8833-7b809e268624.png)

So I'm not sure if this is related to the forms package (due to the validations), a _False-positive_ error check due that the validation is working, or anything related to IVY.


## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

Please create and share minimal reproduction of the issue starting with this template: https://stackblitz.com/fork/angular-issue-repro2
-->

Issues.Title: Update CircleCI config to use new determinisitc image types
Issues.Body:
New `cimg` collection of images from CircleCI have the benefits of:
* More deterministic versioning
* Smaller images sizes
* More shared layers to other languages (more cache hits!)

More info on the new images can be found on https://github.com/CircleCI-Public/cimg-node


All this means more confidence and faster builds on CircleCI.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [x] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
Uses `circleci` image types that have known concerns with determinism and stability.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
 Use new more determinant image type

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information


The image is currently beta, but base image is being used ~20k builds each week, and gorwing every day.

Use and feedback from a community like Angular would be an important milestone for the new types.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update CircleCI config to use new determinisitc image types" (#34455)

Issues.Title: ExpressionChangedAfterChecked error improvements for Ivy
Issues.Body:
PR #34381 improves `ExpressionChangedAfterChecked` error by adding property name for property bindings and also the content of the entire property interpolation. There are few more things that we can improve: - for attribute bindings and interpolations, include attribute name and the entire expression (similar to property bindings and interpolations). - when expression value is an object, the `[Object object]` is printed, we can `JSON.stringify` it (and limit it to 1000 chars or so) - for text interpolations (like `Some exp {{ exp1 }} and {{ exp2 }}`), we can store metadata in `tView.data` and display the whole block when we throw an error - for i18n attributes (like `
`) we can extract property name from i18n metadata (stored in `tView.data`, but using a different format). Currently property name for such cases are not be included into `ExpressionChangedAfterChecked` error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ExpressionChangedAfterChecked error improvements for Ivy" (#34454)

Issues.Title: Sourcemaps for .d.ts files break go to definition in vscode
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package All core packages ### Is this a regression? This is new in version 9 of Angular ### Description In version 9 of Angular the `core.d.ts` file contains a sourcemap link to the `core.d.ts.map` file. The sourcemap file itself also contains the source of the `d.ts` file itself. This throws off the vscode tsserver implementation with the result that go to definition is broken for angular projects. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install Angular CLI 1. Create new project ng new shiny-ivy-app --enable-ivy 1. Build project ng serve 1. Open the project with vscode 1. Open app.component.ts and try to go to definition for Component ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/35014 ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.5

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Proper completions for properties and events
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes autocompletions for properties and events bindings.

The language service will no longer provide bindings like (click) or [id].
Instead, it'll infer the context based on the brackets and provide suggestions
without any brackets.

This fix also adds support for alternative binding syntax such as
`bind-`, `on-`, and `bindon`.

PR closes https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/issues/398
PR closes https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/issues/474

Issues.Title: feat(forms): expand NgModel disabled type to work with strict template type checking
Issues.Body:
NgModel internally coerces any arbitrary value that will assigned
to the `disabled` `@Input` to a boolean. This has been done to
support the common case where developers set the disabled attribute
without a value. For example:

```html
<input type="checkbox" [(ngModel)]="value" disabled>
```

This worked in View Engine without any errors because inputs were
not strictly checked. In Ivy though, developers can opt-in into
strict template type checking where the attribute would be flagged.

This is because the `NgModel#isDisabled` property type-wise only
accepts a `boolean`. To ensure that the common pattern described
above can still be used, and to reflect the actual runtime behavior,
we should add an acceptance member that makes it work without type
checking errors.

Using a coercion member means that this is not a breaking change.

**Note**: I tried creating a test for this.. but it looks like there is no way to AOT compile a component (replicating the scenario above) with strict template checking enabled. Also see #33452
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(forms): expand NgModel disabled type to work with strict template type checking" (#34438)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): HTML path should include last node before cursor
Issues.Body:
Given the following HTML and cursor position: ```
^ cursor is here ``` Note that the cursor is **after** the attribute `c`. Under the current implementation, only `Element` is included in the path. Instead, it should be `Element -> Attribute`. This bug occurs only for cases where the cursor is right after the Node, and it is because the `end` position of the span is excluded from the search. Instead, the `end` position should be included. ## PR Checklist Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements: - [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit - [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features) - [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features) ## PR Type What kind of change does this PR introduce? - [x] Bugfix - [ ] Feature - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables) - [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes) - [ ] Build related changes - [ ] CI related changes - [ ] Documentation content changes - [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes - [ ] Other... Issues.Body:

and thus should not be part of the autocomplete suggestions.

For reference, TypeScript does not provide such completions.

This commit removes these results and cleans up the code.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): reorder provider type checks to align with VE
Issues.Body:
The orderering matters because we don't currently throw if multiple
configurations are provided (i.e. provider has *both* useExisting and
useFactory). We should actually throw an error in this case, but to
avoid another breaking change in v9, this PR simply aligns the Ivy
behavior with ViewEngine.

current Ivy: 
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/d0a04bf30980a60629c22b332de29040cea8e703/packages/core/src/di/r3_injector.ts#L485-L488
VE: 
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/d0a04bf30980a60629c22b332de29040cea8e703/packages/core/src/di/injector.ts#L206-L209

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): append `advance` instructions before `i18nExp`
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, there were no `advance` instructions generated before `i18nExp` instructions and as a result, lifecycle hooks for components used inside i18n blocks were flushed too late. This commit adds the logic to generate `advance` instructions in front of `i18nExp` ones (similar to what we have in other places like interpolations, property bindings, etc), so that the necessary lifecycle hooks are flushed before expression value is captured.

This PR resolves FW-1775.

Yes, it worked fine in RC.4 ### Description I recently updated my project from CLI 9.0.0-rc.4 to 9.0.0-rc.6. After upgrading, my file replacements of environment files are no longer working. Issues.Title: ng build consumes all memory & swap
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Unknown ### Description From time to time (maybe one in 8-10 times) the build seems to run away consuming memory infinitely and crashing my machine if I don't catch it and kill it quick enough. Below is a screen shot of system monitor for one such event (where I did catch it in time) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3340874/70866051-aed14e80-1f32-11ea-96ef-9a9bb6f8e760.png) The build I am running is a slightly modified version of the output from `ng new` ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction 1. Open System Monitor, to resources page, and be ready to kill what you are about to start. 1. clone git@github.com:nsoft/ns-login.git 1. checkout revision 198c3f677d77652f59c6e7b08e4ef1dcf273436d 1. cd into the /admin directory 1. run `ng build` several times (or `./gradlew build` which in turn runs ng build) I have seen this occur with `ng build` run on the command line, run via gradle, or run via intellij invoking gradle when deploying to tomcat. About 50% of the time when this happens the build fails after locking up the computer for a couple minutes. I suspect this the OS killing it (but haven't tried to verify. This survival seems more likely if the machine was not running low on memory to start with. ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error 

No Error, just an unresponsive computer that remains unresponsive >30 min, 
with all memory and swap consumed.
## ğŸŒ Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 8.3.20
Node: 11.8.0
OS: linux x64
Angular: 
... 

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.803.20
@angular-devkit/core         8.3.20
@angular-devkit/schematics   8.3.20
@schematics/angular          8.3.20
@schematics/update           0.803.20
rxjs                         6.4.0
**Anything else relevant?** No browser involved I am developing on Ubuntu 18.0.4. The above specified revision represents a very slightly modified version of the output from `ng new` I am quite new to Angular, and so My normal assumption would be that I've messed something up, and I'd hesitate to file a report, but _intermittent_ run-away memory like this has to be a bug, even if it resulted from some thing I did... I searched, but the bugs I find talk about out of memory errors, and that's not my case. Another interesting bit is that the process list in System Monitor will NOT show any process consuming a corresponding hunk of memory, so you can't find and kill it that way.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng build consumes all memory & swap" (#16454)

Issues.Title: angular component vs ReactDOM.render
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: PS:I have a react component, that have a button and on clicking, a modal popup shows. I compile the react build and use the js and cs files in a chrome extension. My chrome extension put a div with class awvComponent on multiple places in a web app and my react component rendered against each element that have the class. Following code is doing this perfectly. ``` class App extends React.Component { render() { return(
Modal COde here
); } } const elements = document.getElementsByClassName('awvComponent'); for(var i=0; i< elements.length; i++ ){ ReactDOM.render(, elements[i]); } export default App; ``` Now I want to have the same implementation in angular. I have created the same functionality in angular 8. Where I have a component that have button and on clicking button a modal appears. And its selector is awv-component. When I put the selector in app.component.html multiple times my awv-component render multiple times in UI, means multiple button created and each have its own modal. I have to use this functionality in my chrome extension. I created the production build and put js and css code in my extension. My chrome extension injected some tags in web application. And this time angular component only created for first tag and not for the other tags. So is that is achievable in angular 8, to create a angular component and then render it out side the angular app, using the selector, on multiple places of html page ``` Angular Component Reuse
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "angular component vs ReactDOM.render" (#17982)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-slide-toggle): initial checked and disabled state not reflected visually
Issues.Body:
The initial `checked` and `disabled` state of the slide-toggle
is not reflected visually. This is because we sync the disabled
and checked state after the foundation has been created in the
`ngAfterViewInit` lifecycle hook.

The foundation then tries to set the classes on the MDC switch
element using the adapter. The adapter just updates an object
literal that will be passed through `[ngClass]` and relies on
Angular to refresh the view.

This won't work in Ivy because marking a component as dirty
from within the `ngAfterViewInit` lifecycle hook is a noop at the time
of writing. See: FW-1354.

Just using the native element (like we do in other MDC components)
solves this problem and also avoids unnecessary change detections.

Issues.Title: feat(a11y): allow to queue announcements in LiveAnnouncer
Issues.Body:
Standard LiveAnnouncer operates with a single aria-live element, which means that if several
announcements happen at the same time, only the latest one is actually announced. This change adds
`useQueue` configuration to LiveAnnouncerDefaultOptions. When it's set to `true` LiveAnnouncer
creates a separate aria-live element for each of the announcements and places all messages in
the queue, so they are announced one by one.

Fixes #17852
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(a11y): allow to queue announcements in LiveAnnouncer" (#17986)

Issues.Title: Template errors after updating to v9

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help:

it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->

```

  <mat-sidenav #sidenav [opened]="sidenavOpen" [mode]="sidenavOpen ? 'side' : 'over'"

Issues.Title: Closing sidenav with escape does not work when mode is "side"
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Open this [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/sidenav-autofocus-bug) 
2. Click the sidenav.toggle() button to open sidenav
3. Press escape on your keyboard
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
I was expecting the sidenav to close. 

#### Actual Behavior

Sidenav does not close.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2
- CDK/Material: 8.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

#### Workaround

There seems to be 2 workarounds. [Related SO question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59328308/how-to-close-angular-material-sidenav-with-escape).

1. Setting focus inside the sidenav, and then pressing escape
2. Adding a `@HostListener` on the esc key
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Closing sidenav with escape does not work when mode is "side" " (#17965)

Issues.Title: fix(sidenav): unable to close by pressing escape in side mode
Issues.Body:
We currently listen for `keydown` events on the sidenav so that we know when to close it, however in `side` mode we don't trap focus inside the sidenav which means that unless the user goes into the sidenav manually, the escape listener won't work. These changes fix the issue by listening to keyboard events at the `document` level.

Fixes #17965.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(sidenav): unable to close by pressing escape in side mode" (#17967)

Issues.Title: build: update scss-bundle to avoid node-sass dependency
Issues.Body:
The `scss-bundle` package has a dependency on `node-sass` in the older
versions. This makes our tooling reliant on native bindings, and requires
additionally work in framework where we integrate our tooling into a different
environment setup (e.g. different node version).

Regardless of that though, it's generally better not relying on node-sass
or native bindings since we use `sass` (not node-sass) for building with Bazel.

**Note**: we still have an unused dependency on `node-sass` through `gulp-sass`.. but that will be gone eventually.. and at the moment we don't use `node-sass` at all (which is good)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update scss-bundle to avoid node-sass dependency" (#17978)

Issues.Title: build: enable strict attribute type checking
Issues.Body:
When we initially enabled strict template type checking in the
components repository, we temporarily disabled the strict attribute
type checking due to an issue with `NgModel` and the disabled input.

`NgModel` seems to behave as expected and the issue we are facing for
some elements where `NgModel#disabled` is incompatible with the
disabled input of Angular Material components (where string is allowed)
is correctly reported by ngtsc.

We can satisfy both input signatures and actually enable the flag to
catch attribute typing/coercion issues which are actually affecting
components we ship.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: enable strict attribute type checking" (#17977)

Fixes #17974.

Issues.Title: feat(material/*): First pass implementation of focus indicators.
Issues.Body:
**Demo:** http://100.88.8.105:4200

**Implementation summary:**

* Focus indicators were added to all components other than chips.
  * Focus indicators only added to elements that had associated click handlers. For example: `mat-selection-list` and `mat-dialog` are focusable, but not expected to ever have click handlers. If we want focus indicators for these elements, we can add them in a follow-up PR.
  * Chips will be in a follow-up PR. Focus indicator for chips likely requires an additional element.
* The class `.mat-focus-indicator` was added to the appropriate elements within each component. Components with multiple focusable elements had `.mat-focus-indicator` added to multiple elements.
  * For almost all components (besides the ones below), the class `.mat-focus-indicator` is added to the element that has focus (the actual `document.activeElement`).  Focus indicator is rendered when element has focus.
  * For checkbox, radio, and slide toggle, the class `.mat-focus-indicator` is added to the associated `mat-ripple`. This is because the actual focused input is visually hidden and consequently does not have a bounding box to render the focus indicator on. Focus indicator is rendered when the class `.cdk-focused` is present on the parent checkbox/radio/slide toggle.
  * For option, each `.mat-option` does not actually take focus as a user arrows through the options. Focus indicator is rendered when the option is active (i.e. when the class `.mat-active` is present).
* The focus indicator itself is rendered on `.mat-focus-indicator::before`. The before pseudo-element is positioned absolutely. The `.mat-focus-indicator` element is positioned relatively.
* For most components, the focus indicator has no inset/offset. For some components, the focus indicator does have inset/offset. This decision was made on a per-component basis. All components support inset focus indicators, not all components support offset focus indicators. FWIW, I believe that any component that *needs* to support offset focus indicators *does* support offset focus indicators.
* All focus indicator CSS is decoupled from core CSS. Users must manually pull in `mat-strong-focus-indicators` and `mat-strong-focus-indicators-theme` mixins.
* Focus indicator is either the primary color of the theme or a user-specified color. Some mechanism to invert the color will be added in a follow-up PR.

**Some notes:**

* What's nice about using the actual focused element as the host for the focus indicator (i.e. the host for the pseudo-element) is that SRs will also draw their focus indicators on this element. It's important that the actual focused element has an appropriate bounding box, and this feature helps to enforce that. I think this is really nice.
* No new elements were added!
* `position: relative` was added to 3 components. If this is a problem, make note. These changes can also potentially live within the focus indicator mixin.
* Focus indicator appears on mouse click, which is weird. It shows up a little more frequently when using a mouse than I'd like. This is something we'll have to address in a future PR.
* Have not tested on high contrast yet.

I'll squash/rename my commits before merging to follow naming conventions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/*): First pass implementation of focus indicators." (#17966)
